lines.text: Bed? Beds are for sleepy people! Let's get a kebab and go to a disco!
Why does Dorothy still live with her parents?
Her Mother keeps threatening to kill herself if she moves out, I think she should risk it.

[Tony has been trying to tattoo himself with a darning needle]
It was going to read "Deborah, I love you", but now I'm just going for "Deb".

[trying to get Deborah to sleep with him, she is into astrology at the time]
I must lie down here in conjunction with you...

[doing a crossword puzzle]
Twelve across, five letters, god. That's got to be Jesus, right?
They're not the same thing, though, are they?
Yeah, Jesus is the same as God, isn't he? A bit younger.

Let's face it Tony, the only way you're gonna be in there is that if you're both marooned on a deserted island and she eats a poisonous berry or a nut which makes her temporarily deaf, dumb, stupid, forgetful and desperate for sex.
See the graffiti in the gents has reached new heights of literacy.
Oh yeah, whats it say?
"West-Ham is a poof".
You really are a yob aren't you Gary?
On the contrary, I think I'm remarkably sensitive.
Oh, that must be why you refer to Luciano Pavarotti as "that fat git".
Oh look Tony I'm really sorry if I've hurt you.
How do you mean?
Oh, y'know, me going out with Ray.
Hardly even noticed to be honest.
So why did you open the window and shout "get lost smug estate agent bastard" at him?
No, you see that wasn't him, that was this other estate agent on the other side of the road.
And he says he caught you pushing potato peelings through his car window.
Oh yeah, I did do that. What, so you want me to stop?
Y'know, I think marriage is tremendous.
I hate to be cynical George, but you think Croydon is tremendous.

[talking about women's pain threshold]
I mean, look at the fuss women make about child birth. Now, I'm not saying it doesn't smart a bit, but if blokes did it, I reckon you'd be looking at, what, give birth, have a couple of Paracetamol, maybe a bit of a nap and then back to work within the hour.
Gary doesn't understand periods. He thinks they're something to do with the moon.
